page.title: 07Population
page.content: The population is mixed social classes & changes little. Numbers do not vary much as the Kent Structure Plan & Metropolitan Green Belt Policies militate against new building in this rural area. In 1984 the number of electors on the Roll in the area of the Hoath in this survey 139. If the strip of Cowden to the west & the strip of Penshurst to the east are included the number is about 200. Of the Hoath electors there are about 42 retired people. 3 over retirement age are still earning and 94 adults below 60 yrs. There are about 32 children below 18 yrs. Of those below 60 yrs some are working and some women at home. The working population is composed of about 16 going to London and its environs and about 34 working locally or in nearby towns.
